info.powah.gen.mode.desc:
The Reactor will stop when it is full and start 
when it has less than 70% of its energy capacity.
jei.powah.player_aerial_pearl: Use an Aerial Pearl on Zombie or Husk.
jei.powah.binding_card_dim: Use a Binding card on Enderman or Endermite.
jei.powah.lens_of_ender: Use a Photoelectric Pane on Enderman or Endermite.
chat.powah.not.enough.blocks: Not enough Blocks! You need %s more!
chat.powah.no.binding: This Card is already bound to %s!
wiki.powah.furnator_0: A Furnator generates energy (FE) from solid Furnace fuel like coal and wood
wiki.powah.furnator_1: Higher tiers generate more FE per tick (FE/t), have a higher energy output, and burn fuel faster.
wiki.powah.magmator_0: A Magmator generates energy (FE) from high temp fluids like lava.
wiki.powah.magmator_1: Higher tiers generate more FE per tick (FE/t), have a higher energy output, and burn fuel faster.
wiki.powah.thermo_generator_0: A Thermo Generator generates energy (FE) when placed on top of a high temp fluid or block, like lava or magma blocks. It requires a fluid coolant like water. Coolant can be added using a bucket or a fluid pipe from another mod.
wiki.powah.solar_panel_0: A Solar Panel generates energy (FE) when exposed to sunlight. Higher tiers generate more FE per tick (FE/t). Any block above the Solar Panel that stops light will stop energy generation.
wiki.powah.reactor_0: A Reactor generates energy (FE) from Uraninite and is a multi-block.
wiki.powah.reactor_1: You need 36 Reactor blocks in your hand and a 3x3x4 area to place it. It will build itself automatically after the first block is placed.
wiki.powah.reactor_2: A Reactor heats up when it generates energy, which causes it to consume Uraninite faster and generate fewer FE per tick (FE/t). You can reduce heat by adding a fluid coolant like water. In addition, you can add solid coolants, like snow or ice, to further reduce the heat.
wiki.powah.reactor_3: Keep the reactor buffer full of fuel for better production. More information is on the next page.
wiki.powah.reactor_4: Carbon materials like coal and wood will improve Uraninite fuel efficiency and add +180 C of heat.
wiki.powah.reactor_5: Redstone will speed up energy generation, increase fuel consumption, and add +120 C of heat.
wiki.powah.reactor_6: A Reactor will stop when it is full of energy. It will resume energy generation when it has less than 70% of its energy capacity, if Auto Mode is on.
wiki.powah.energy_cell_0: An Energy Cell stores energy (FE) for use later.
wiki.powah.energy_cell_1: They are used to store excess energy from generators. They can also be used to add capacity to a channel on the Ender Network. Read about Ender Cells to learn more.
wiki.powah.ender_cell_0: An Ender Cell allows cable-less energy (FE) transfer from anywhere in the world using the Ender Network.
wiki.powah.ender_cell_1: Ender Cells are connected to the Ender Network and channels are used to transfer energy. Channels start without any capacity and can't transfer energy until they have capacity.
wiki.powah.ender_cell_2: You add capacity to a channel by right-clicking an Ender Cell and shift-clicking an Energy Cell or Battery in your inventory. The capacity of the Energy Cell or Battery will be permanently added to the selected channel and the item will be consumed. Also, any energy in the item will be added to the channel.
wiki.powah.ender_cell_3: Higher tiers of Ender Cells have access to more channels.
wiki.powah.energy_cable_0: An Energy Cable is used to transfer energy (FE) between machines.
wiki.powah.energy_cable_1: You can change the transfer mode by right-clicking a cable using <powah:wrench> with Config mode selected.
wiki.powah.ender_gate_0: An Ender Gate transfers energy (FE) between the adjacent block and a channel on the Ender Network.
wiki.powah.ender_gate_1: You can not upgrade the Ender Network using an Ender Gate, but you can using an Ender Cell.
wiki.powah.energizing_0: An Energizing Orb is used to Energize items, turning them into something new. Energizing requires at least one Energizing Rod within a %s range. Energizing speed depends on the amount of Energizing Rods and their tier.
wiki.powah.energizing_1: An Energizing Orb does not require energy but Energizing Rods must be placed on Energy Cables or another Powah block with energy.
wiki.powah.energizing_2: An Energizing Orb and Energizing Rods will automatically link to each other when they are in range. You can use the <powah:wrench> in Link mode to view the link and manually link.
wiki.powah.player_transmitter_0: A Player Transmitter charges items in a player's inventory including armor slots and off-hand. Insert a Binding Card that has been bound to a player to begin charging. A Binding Card will charge anywhere in the same dimension. Use a Binding Card (Dimensional) to charge across dimensions..
wiki.powah.energy_discharger_0: An Energy Discharger drains energy (FE) out of charged items like Batteries. The drained energy is stored and can be extracted at any time.
wiki.powah.energy_hopper_0: An Energy Hopper charges items inside an adjacent inventory like a chest or any block with an inventory. It is directional and must point toward the inventory.
wiki.powah.wrench_1: Config Mode: used to change Energy Cables I/O configuration.
wiki.powah.wrench_2: Link Mode: used to link blocks that are capable of linking like an Energizing Orb and Energizing ods.
wiki.powah.wrench_3: Rotate Mode: used to rotate blocks horizontally.
wiki.powah.battery_0: Batteries charge items in a player's inventory, including items from other mods. They can also be used to add capacity to a channel on the Ender Network. Read about Ender Cells to learn more.
wiki.powah.player_aerial_pearl_0: A Player Aerial Pearl used to craft the Player Transmitter.
wiki.powah.player_aerial_pearl_1: It is obtained by crafting an Aerial Pearl and right-clicking on a Zombie or Husk. This turns the Aerial Pearl into a Player Aerial Pearl.
wiki.powah.binding_card_0: A Binding Card links a player with a Player Transmitter, allowing cable-less charging in the same dimension.
wiki.powah.binding_card_1: It must be linked to a player before adding it to the Player Transmitter. Hold the Binding Card and right-click to bind.
wiki.powah.binding_card_dim_0: A Binding Card (Dimensional) is used to link a player with a Player Transmitter, allowing cable-less charging in the across dimension.
wiki.powah.binding_card_dim_1: It must be linked to a player before adding it to the Player Transmitter. Hold the Binding Card (Dimensional) and right-click to bind.
wiki.powah.charged_snowball_0: Throwing a Charged Snowball will cause a bolt of lightning to spawn when hitting the ground or a mob. It is obtained by Energizing a snowball using an Energizing Orb and Energizing Rods.
wiki.powah.lens_of_ender_0: A Lens Of Ender can be added to a Solar Panel to generate energy even if blocks are above the Solar Panel. It created by crafting a Photoelectric Pane and right-clicking it on an Enderman or Endermite
wiki.powah.uraninite_0: Uraninite Ore is found underground and is used to create and fuel Reactors. There are multiple tiers of Uraninite ore: poor is below level 64, normal is below level 20, and dense is below level 0. Uraninite ore is found in 1 to 5 block veins.
wiki.powah.uraninite_1: An iron or better pickaxe is required to mine it and it is affected by Fortune. Energizing Uraninite Ore will generate the most Uraninite per ore.
wiki.powah.dry_ice_0: Dry Ice is used to cool reactors. It is found underground (below level 64) or it can be made by Energizing two blue ice.
